text: Ivor Owen Grattan-Guinness (23 June 1941 â€“ 12 December 2014) was an English historian and mathematician. He was a historian of mathematics and logic. Grattan-Guinness was born in Bakewell, Derbyshire. He gained his bachelor degree as a Mathematics Scholar at Wadham College, Oxford, and an MSc (Econ) in Mathematical Logic and the Philosophy of Science at the London School of Economics in 1966. He died on 12 December 2014, aged 73.The Canadian Society for History and Philosophy of Mathematics: Recent News (Accessed Dec 16th 2014) ==References== ==Other websites== * Encomium at Mathematical Sciences Foundation Category:1941 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Alumni of the University of Oxford Category:English historians Category:English mathematicians Category:People from Derbyshire
title: Ivor Grattan-Guinness
